semantic_title: Placeholder Character 'X': Usage and Requirements for Code Expansion
section_path: Section I > A. Conventions > 4. Placeholder character

content.full_text: The ICD-10-CM utilizes a placeholder character 'X'. The 'X' is used as a placeholder at certain codes to allow for future expansion. An example of this is at the poisoning, adverse effect and underdosing codes, categories T36-T50. Where a placeholder exists, the X must be used in order for the code to be considered a valid code. (Evidence: pg no: 8, L27-L29)
